keyword: how many calories in an apple fritter
title: How Many Calories in an Apple Fritter?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in an apple fritter, including carbs, fat, protein, and other nutrients based on a standard bakery version, plus tweaks and FAQs.
h1: How Many Calories in an Apple Fritter?
assumptions: Standard bakery apple fritter (~100 g), fried yeast dough with apple-cinnamon filling, powdered sugar glaze, no nuts or extra toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by bakery, recipe, size, frying oil, and glaze amount. Check labels or apps for specific brands.

quick_answer.text: One standard apple fritter contains about 350 calories, mostly from carbs and fat.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in an apple fritter from a bakery?
faqs.a: Typically 350 kcal for a standard 100 g fritter.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in an apple fritter?
faqs.a: About 50 g total carbs, including 25 g sugars and 2 g fiber.

faqs.q: Is an apple fritter high in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, around 15 g fat per fritter, with 3 g saturated and 0.5 g trans fat from frying.

faqs.q: How does apple fritter nutrition compare to a plain doughnut?
faqs.a: Similar calories (300-400 kcal), but fritter has more sugars and fiber from apples.

faqs.q: Can I make a lower-calorie apple fritter?
faqs.a: Yes, baking reduces fat; opt for unglazed or air-fried versions to cut 50-100 kcal.
